creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
text: siteTree.getNode(documentId) == null should be siteTree.getNode(documentId) != null.

creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
text:
Created attachment 14452
Patch for src/java/org/apache/lenya/cms/cocoon/acting/DocumentIdExistsAction.java

The attachement also proposes an enhancement of this class so that it can be
used to decide if a given document-id exists in a given area (before it assumed
the document to be in the authoring area only. This behaviour is retained for
backward compatibility if no area is given).

(In reply to comment #1)
This way, you can check the existance of a document in the sitemap and send a
"Page not found" gracefully if it is inexistant.
creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
text:
Created attachment 14491
Patch for src/java/org/apache/lenya/cms/cocoon/acting/DocumentIdExistsAction.java

The DocumentIdExistsAction executes the enclosed part in the matcher if the
document does NOT exist. Intuitively, it should be the other way round (e.g.
resource-exists action).

creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
text:
Created attachment 14492
Patch for src/webapp/lenya/usecase.xmap

Changed behaviour of DocumentIdExistsAction requires rearranging of matcher.
